channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)

item.title: Texas Republicans have gerrymandered their way into a corner
item.description: If the courts don’t stop them, Hispanic voters may punish them

item.title: A Historic G-20—Without the United States
item.description: South Africa gets ready to host the bloc’s first summit in Africa.

item.title: China built the energy transition while democracies debated
item.description: From solar panels to batteries, the industrial spine of decarbonisation runs through factories the West does not control.

item.title: U.S., Russia Draft Secret New Peace Deal for Ukraine
item.description: The proposal would cede some Ukrainian territory to Moscow in exchange for U.S. security guarantees.

item.title: A terrible American-Russian proposal to end the war in Ukraine
item.description: Steve Witkoff’s “peace deal” looks like a Russian wish list, and Ukraine is not biting

item.title: U.S.-Saudi Bonhomie Masks Divide Over Nuclear Technology
item.description: The Saudi crown prince’s flashy trip to Washington was not enough to secure a formal atomic cooperation accord.

item.title: Hasina Verdict Raises Specter of Violence in Bangladesh
item.description: The former prime minister was sentenced to death in absentia months before a high-stakes election.

item.title: Cracks are appearing in OpenAI’s dominant facade
item.description: A deal between Anthropic, Microsoft and Nvidia makes AI more circular

item.title: Don’t let a scandal undermine the defence of Ukraine
item.description: Outrage is justified. Letting Vladimir Putin win would be disastrous

item.title: How Chinese-linked hackers co-opted Anthropic’s Claude
item.description: The group used it to launch an AI agent that then went on the attack

item.title: How China-linked hackers co-opted Anthropic’s Claude
item.description: The group used it to launch an AI agent that then went on the attack

item.title: Can South Korea Afford the Many Costs of Nuclear-Powered Submarines?
item.description: A Trumpian promise may be hard to deliver.

item.title: America’s huge mortgage market is slowly dying
item.description: Mr Trump’s remedies threaten to inflame a housing crisis

item.title: A better way to look for signs of ancient biology
item.description: It could also be useful in finding life on other planets

item.title: Geothermal kit can help make the power grid flexible
item.description: It is potentially cheaper and longer-lasting than lithium batteries

item.title: The Good News on Women’s Rights
item.description: How some countries are quietly advancing progress.

item.title: The Good News on Women’s Rights
item.description: How some countries are quietly advancing progress.

item.title: Tech billionaires want to make gene-edited babies
item.description: Widespread bans don’t seem to be a hindrance

item.title: What to Know About the Secret U.S.-Russia Peace Plan for Ukraine
item.description: Steve Witkoff reportedly hashed the details out with Putin’s envoy in Miami last month.

item.title: Only Liberal Nationalism Can Defeat the Far Right
item.description: Convinced that nationalism belongs to the past, liberals have largely abandoned appeals to cultural identity, allowing far-right political entrepreneurs to fill the void. To counter exclusionary nationalism, liberals must craft a unifying creed that restores a sense of shared destiny.

item.title: The use of a rare wood pits violinists against environmentalists
item.description: Pernambuco has been used for centuries because of its unique sound

item.title: Maduro Needs a Golden Parachute
item.description: The only way to avoid war in Venezuela may be if its leader doesn’t fear leaving office.

item.title: How Progressives Can Win on Immigration
item.description: For rudderless center-left parties, the debate around asylum and immigration should be seen not as a necessary evil, but as a political opportunity. By anchoring tougher enforcement in an authentic social-democratic agenda, the left can show that it has better solutions than the far right.

item.title: In Kazakhstan, Both Pro- and Anti-Russian Voice Are Urged Toward Silence
item.description: A pro-Russian blogger was sentenced to nearly four years; meanwhile, an activist urging the boycotting of Russian artists was called in for a conversation.

item.title: Putin’s Unlikely Envoy to Washington
item.description: Kirill Dmitriev is a prominent purveyor of the Kremlin’s line—but real power may lie elsewhere.

item.title: Delay as a weapon: Fighting – and winning – on the clock
item.description: From the South China Sea to the battlefields in Ukraine, negotiations that never end can give a false sense of stability.

item.title: Beyond Trade: China’s Political Power In Mexico
item.description: The U.S. strategy appears to have overlooked a central component of China’s influence in Mexico.

item.title: Let a Thousand AI Regimes Bloom
item.description: While critics of decentralized technology regulation warn of higher compliance costs for businesses, Chinese-style centralization is hardly preferable. In fact, not only do regulatory patchworks tend to converge, but they also provide the flexibility that rapid technological change demands.

item.title: Chinese Artificial General Intelligence: Myths and Misinformation
item.description: Insights from William C. Hannas and Huey-Meei Chang.

item.title: Regional Leadership on Global Tipping Points
item.description: Climate tipping points can seem like science fiction, making them difficult to monitor and mitigate. To ensure that tipping-point dynamics are a central consideration in infrastructure planning, financial regulation, and development policy, regional bodies must develop the capacity to track and respond to them.

item.title: China has too many university graduates and too few jobs for them
item.description: It wants to push youngsters towards vocational colleges instead

item.title: What Australians Think of China and the US in the Trump Era
item.description: This year’s annual poll by UTS:ACRI shows skepticism of both major powers, and a strong desire for Australian autonomy.

item.title: What’s Behind India’s Political Rapprochement With the Taliban?
item.description: A path toward recognition or an instrument of influence?

item.title: How Will Japan’s New Leader Approach the North Korea Problem?
item.description: Like her predecessors, Takaichi has offered a summit to resolve the abductees issue. North Korea is unlikely to be interested.

item.title: Kazakhstan: Another Blow to the LGBTQ Community and Freedom of Expression
item.description: Silencing minorities is never the way forward. Kazakhstan must remember its human rights commitments and immediately drop the legal changes.

item.title: Is Donald Trump preparing to strike Venezuela or lining up a deal?
item.description: The answer is both

item.title: Why the US Economy Has Remained Stronger Than Expected
item.description: Although most economists have issued dire warnings about the damage tariffs and other ill-advised policies would cause, the US economy’s aggregate indicators have remained quite robust. Some of the costs may simply have been postponed, but rapid advances in AI could well offset them when they fall due.

item.title: Trump-Xi meeting defuses US-China hostility, for now
item.description:
On October 30th the US president, Donald Trump, and his…

The post Trump-Xi meeting defuses US-China hostility, for now appeared first on Economist Intelligence Unit.

item.title: Indonesia’s Defense Plans Remain a Mystery
item.description: Every month seems to bring a new Indonesian arms deal, but there is no updated and publicly accessible strategic document to tie them all together.

item.title: Afghanistan-Pakistan Relations Hinge on Their Ability to Tackle TTP
item.description: Pakistan’s aggression against the Taliban regime and threats to wage war if the TTP problem is not resolved point to frustration and anger in Islamabad.

item.title: America’s Allies Should Go Nuclear
item.description: Selective proliferation will strengthen the global order, not end it.

item.title: AI Is Supercharging Disinformation Warfare
item.description: America's defenses aren't ready for AI disinformation warfare.
